title: Effects of cash deposit at AGK Bank

content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

Stephanie opens a new checking account and deposits <math alttext="$9,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mtext>$9,000</mtext></mstyle></math> in cash at <math alttext="A G K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mtext>AGK</mtext></mstyle></math> Bank. The required reserve ratio is <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent, and the banking system has limited reserves.

(a) What is the amount by which <math alttext="A G K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mtext>AGK</mtext></mstyle></math> Bank’s liabilities have changed? Explain.

(b) Calculate the change in required reserves for <math alttext="A G K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mtext>AGK</mtext></mstyle></math> Bank. Show your work.

(c) What is the dollar value of the maximum amount of new loans <math alttext="A G K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mtext>AGK</mtext></mstyle></math> Bank can initially make from Stephanie’s deposit? Explain.

(d) As a result of Stephanie’s deposit, calculate the maximum amount by which the money supply can change throughout the banking system. Show your work.

(e) How will the change in the money supply in part (d) affect aggregate demand and unemployment in the short run? Explain.
content.question: Respond to all parts of the question.

frqParts.text: Respond to all parts of the question.

topic.text: 3.6: Changes in the AD-AS Model in the Short Run

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
